articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Grenada
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Grenada
Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Choe Yong Rim Monday sent a message of greetings to Tillman Thomas, Prime Minister of Grenada, on the 37th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Preview of Feature Film Held
articles.content:
Preview of Feature Film Held
 Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- The preview of the Korean feature film "Wave of Songgang" (parts one and two) took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Monday.
					 The film deals with the struggle of the workers and officials of the Songjin Steel Complex who completed Korean-style iron production system under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, true to the intention of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The film also shows that the great success of the Korean-style iron and steel making processes is a brilliant victory of the President's original idea on production of Juche iron and a result of the tremendous mental power of the workers of the complex boundlessly loyal to the party and the leader.
					
					 Watching the film were senior party and state officials, the chairman of a friendly party and officials of working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and the field of metal industry and others.

articles.title: New Stamps Released
articles.content:
New Stamps Released 
 Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK released new stamps (four kinds of individual stamps) on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il which falls February 16.
					 The stamps carry pictures of Cercopithecus aethiops, Hystrix indica, Capra hircus and Cebuella pygmaea presented to him by personages of Kuwait and Sweden as gifts.

articles.title: World Foodstuff Price Hits Record High
articles.content:
World Foodstuff Price Hits Record High
 Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- Price of foodstuff is skyrocketing worldwide, sparking serious concern.
					 The monthly world foodstuff price indices have gone up 3.4 percent in the period from December last year to January this year, said FAO of the United Nations on Feb. 3 quoting a survey data.
					
					 This is an all-time high since 1990 when foodstuff price survey kicked off. The price of foodstuff is expected to continue to soar in the coming months.

articles.title: Chinese Folktale Adapted as Opera in Korea
articles.content:
Chinese Folktale Adapted as Opera in Korea 
Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- The Chinese folktale "A Dream of Red Mansions" written hundreds of years ago is considered to be one of the works representing 5,000 years of the Chinese nation's traditional culture.
					 When the opera based on the folktale was being recreated in Korea, Chinese people wondered whether foreigners could adapt the wide-ranging and profound story as an opera.
					
					 But the Phibada Opera Troupe of Korea successfully recreated the opera and made a performance tour of seven Chinese cities, including Beijing, from May 2010, enjoying a great popularity among Chinese people.
					
					 From July 5, it performed the opera again in Beijing.
					
					 The audience admired the performers for their artistic ability, beautiful dances and songs, lifelike acting and wonderful backgrounds.
					
					 It was in the 1960s that the opera "A Dream of Red Mansions" was created in Korea for the first time on the initiative of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave an instruction to recreate the opera to celebrate the year of DPRK-China friendship, 2010, and guided it on the spot more than once.
					
					 After enjoying the performance, Chinese people said the Korean opera gave a vivid representation of the story and its characters.

articles.title: Paper Used for Making Arrow-proof Fatigues
articles.content:
Paper Used for Making Arrow-proof Fatigues
 Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- Arrow-proof fatigues made of paper are one of the cultural heritages associated with the resourcefulness and wisdom of the Koreans.
					 Jong Song Ho, room chief of the Folklore Institute of the Academy of Social Sciences, 36, said that Korean fighters donned not only armors but fatigues made of paper in battles for a long period. He continued:
					
					 According to "Korean Geography" compiled in 1481, kapuiji (a kind of Korean paper) was used for making arrow-proof fatigues in battles. As it was heavy for a fighter to wear fatigues made of iron sheets for protecting himself from arrows, paper was used instead for the same purpose. They, though light in weight, were as strong as armor. Fatigues made of paper are believed to be used in the period before the compilation of the book.
					
					 In those period Koreans made kapuiji from paper mulberry and used it for producing arrow-proof fatigues called jigap.
					
					 In order to produce the above-said fatigues they went through the following process: Kapuiji was cut into required shapes and sizes or folded several times to obtain the shape of the fatigues. They were tied with deerskin strap and carefully lacquered horizontally, lengthwise and diagonally before getting them dry outside. This process was repeated two or three times.
					
					 There were several kinds of arrow-proof fatigues made of paper like jichalgap, jiphoomsimgap and jijebaegap. Jichalgap was made of small pieces of folded layers of paper. Jiphoomsimgap was arrow-proof vest made of paper and fabrics. Jijebaegap was made by quilting 10-15 layers of paper.

articles.title: New Variety of Zinc Composite Fertilizer Proves Efficacious
articles.content:
New Variety of Zinc Composite Fertilizer Proves Efficacious
 Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- A new variety of zinc composite fertilizer developed by Kye Ung Sang College of Agriculture of Kim Il Sung University has proved efficacious in the agricultural field.
					 It contains varieties of organic and inorganic nutritious elements. It helps promote the growth of crops and raise their yield. It is good for preventing roots of rice plants from being rotten in paddies. It is in wide use for keeping seeds and raising rice seedlings on cold-beds.
					
					 This fertilizer had been successfully applied to more than 10,000 hectares of fields under crops and vegetables in North and South Hwanghae provinces up to last year.
					
					 A dynamic drive is now under way to apply the fertilizer to more units in the agricultural field.

articles.title: Japan with Long History of Missile Development
articles.content:
Japan with Long History of Missile Development
 Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- Japan, in its new "defense program guidelines", describes the DPRK's nuclear and missile development as military threat.
					 This trite description is aimed to realize its militarization.
					
					 Japan's missile program reveals that its missile technology has already reached a high level.
					
					 Japan's first anti-ship missile is "ASM-1" designed to attack large or middle-sized warships.
					
					 Japan started the development of the missile in 1972 and completed it in 1981. Next year the missile was introduced in the "air self-defense force." Its maximum range was 50 kilometers but increased considerably later.
					
					 The Defense Agency of Japan launched in earnest the development of medium-range missile "XSSM-1" in 1984. The hedgehopping missile, 5 meters long and 650 kilograms heavy, went into commission in 1990.
					
					 As for anti-tank missile, Japan developed its first generation in 1957 and second generation seven years later. The third and fourth generations already came into being.
					
					 A laser-guided anti-tank missile developed in 1978 underwent tests in 1982 and 1985 and began to be supplied to military units in 1990.
					
					 The above-mentioned facts are part of Japan's missile development.
					
					 Japan's carrier rockets for "H-2," "M-5" and "N" satellites can be simply changed into long-range missiles.
					
					 All the facts show that Japan's talk about the DPRK's missile threat is just for hoodwinking the international community.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Return Cultural Artifacts of Korea--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Return Cultural Artifacts of Korea--Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists vandalized and looted in a systematic and organized way the precious cultural artifacts of Korea during their colonial rule of nearly half century over it. Japan should honestly admit and apologize for this heinous crime and return all the looted artifacts to Korea.
					 Rodong Sinmun makes this demand in a bylined article Monday.
					
					 Recalling the recent foreign news report that Korean cultural assets in Japan total to hundreds of thousands of pieces, the article says:
					
					 According to testimonies of Japanese, there are 40,000 cultural artifacts of Korea, including ceramic wares, at the national museum in Tokyo.
					
					 Besides, many Korean cultural relics of variety are in the possession of museums, art galleries, universities, temples, art schools, institutions and individuals across Japan. Among them are ceramic ware, metal handicraft, image of Buddha, gem cutting craftwork, grass-work, mother-of-pearl work, drawing, book and printing type.
					
					 Tens of thousands of Koryo ceramics are reported to be on display in different parts of Japan.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists registered those looted artifacts as Japan's "national treasure" and openly exhibited them at museums. 
					
					 Over half century has passed since the defeat of the Japanese imperialists. But many of the cultural relics of Korea looted by them have not yet been opened to the public.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists' rude vandalism and loot of cultural artifacts, the mental and material heritage, in Korea are a never-to-be-condoned crime as it was aimed to trample down the cultural tradition and soul of the Korean nation and obliterate the nation itself.

articles.title: All Politicians Should Fulfill Responsibility and Role for Nation
articles.content:
All Politicians Should Fulfill Responsibility and Role for Nation
 Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- The politicians in the north and the south should serve the nation before seeking the interests of class, social standings and political factions, Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a bylined article. 
					 No problem will be insoluble between the north and the south if the politicians buckle down to the work from the stand of giving priority to the nation in the spirit of "by our nation itself" to realize the nation's wish for reunification and interests, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The politicians in the south should give top priority to the nation and subjugate the interests, policy and ism of individual political group to the great cause of the nation. They should also take the lead in the grand march of the nation for reconciliation, unity, peace and reunification. 
					
					 An urgent task facing the politicians in the north and the south at present is to hold contact and dialogues. The north-south high-ranking military talks are due to open soon and civilians of different circles are becoming increasingly vocal for dialogue. It is quite unreasonable for the politicians to remain indifferent to this situation. 
					
					 They should seek active bilateral and multilateral negotiations to fulfill their historical mission and duty before the times and the nation. 
					
					 There is no obstacle in the way of contacts and dialogues between them. More contacts and dialogues would help deepen understanding and confidence, contributing to the improved north-south relations. 
					
					 Whoever is a politician valuing the nation should orientate his or her thinking and activities to tiding over the present ordeals and reunifying the country. All the Koreans hope that the politicians in the north and the south would take the lead in the patriotic drive for reunification for the destiny and common interests of the nation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Speeding up Ongoing Offensive
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Speeding up Ongoing Offensive
 Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- All the people should bring about a drastic turn in the improvement of the people's living standard and the building of a thriving nation this year, says DPRK major newspaper Rodong Sinmun in an editorial on Monday.
					To this end, it is needed to accelerate the advance for a great surge at the highest speed keeping pace with General Secretary Kim Jong Il's forced march of field guidance, adds the editorial.
					
					 The history of guidance by Kim Jong Il born with offensive spirit and courage of Mt. Paektu is a sacred history of the peerlessly great man who has led the Korean revolution only to victory through his guerrilla-style forced march, it says.
					
					 It goes on to say:
					
					 The course of his march is for successfully meeting the desire of President Kim Il Sung to realize the people's ideal and provide them with happiness. It is also a road of shining victory in which he has wrought epochal miracles while braving the manifold difficulties.
					
					 His ceaseless march has brought world-startling events. The Huichon Speed, a new version of the Chollima Speed in the era of Songun, was created and mass-production of Juche iron, Juche fiber and Juche fertilizer has turned the whole country into a big jubilee.
					
					 The miracle wrought in Taegyedo showed the spirit that Korea does what it is determined to do. A world-leading combined fruit farm was built in Wonhung and lots of modern production bases and fairylands fit for the era of Songun have emerged one after another. This is the reality of our dignified country.
					
					 When the army and people keep pace with their leader in the advance for a great surge and give free reins to their inexhaustible mental power to give uninterrupted spurs to the general offensive, they can win greater victory and fling open the gate to a thriving nation in 2012, a significant year.

articles.title: Korean People's Effort to Build Thriving Nation Hailed
articles.content:
Korean People's Effort to Build Thriving Nation Hailed
						
 Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- Baluchistan Times, a Pakistani newspaper, carried an article titled "Strength of Korea" in its January 30th issue on the occasion of the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The article said that as the DPRK has tremendous strength the U.S. does not dare to provoke.
					
					 Its military power has grown stronger after Kim Jong Il gained the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the chairmanship of the DPRK National Defence Commission, the article stressed.
					
					 He formulated the Songun politics as the basic political mode of socialism and has strengthened the KPA into invincible armed forces through his ceaseless field guidance to the army, it noted.
					
					In the society of the DPRK the leader, the party and the masses are one community united by the common destiny, it said, adding: General Secretary Kim Jong Il is the center of the single-minded unity of the whole society and its ideological basis is the Juche idea, the Songun idea.
					
					 The Korean people having tremendous national power will surely hit the goal of building a great, prosperous and powerful socialist nation in the near future, the article said.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Printed in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Printed in Russia
 Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On Some Questions in Understanding the Juche Philosophy" was brought out in booklet by the Russian Association for Development of Friendship and Cooperation with Foreign Countries on Feb. 3.
					 The work, published on April 2, Juche 63 (1974), clarifies that the Juche philosophy is man-centered as it raises fundamental question of philosophy by regarding man as the main factor and elucidates an outlook on the world, a viewpoint and attitude towards the world, by focusing on man. It also refers to what distinguishes the Juche philosophy from a human philosophy.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- It was one day in November of 1945 that journalists of the Saegil Newspaper visited the lodging quarters where Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero, put up. They asked her to tell about the battles she fought to crush the Japanese imperialists. 
					 Noting that she had nothing to say particularly about herself, she told them about the outstanding strategy and tactics and combat methods with which President Kim Il Sung led the anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory. 
					
					 Upon hearing her, a journalist again requested her to tell about her own struggle. 
					
					  She responded to his request by saying that it was quite natural for the newspapers to carry stories about the President, adding that the history of the leader contained the stories about his soldiers. 
					
					 She urged the newspapers to explain well the line and policies of the President to powerfully encourage the masses to vigorously turn out in the building of a new country. 
					
					 That day the journalists were deeply touched by the personality of Kim Jong Suk as a great woman whose fervent loyalty to the leader was her inborn disposition.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun reclama la unidad entre politicos del Norte y el Sur
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun reclama la unidad entre politicos del Norte y el Sur
 Pyongyang, 7 de febrero (ATCC) -- En un articulo individual difundido este lunes, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala que los politicos del Norte y el Sur de Corea deben trabajar para toda la nacion antes de defender los intereses de algunas clases, capas y fracciones que representan.
					  Si ellos deciden y actuan asumiendo la posicion de dar importancia a la nacion y en el principio de "Entre nosotros, los connacionales" para realizar el deseo de la nacion coreana de reunificar el pais y satisfacer los intereses de ella, no habran problemas imposibles de resolver entre ambas partes coreanas, comienza el articulista y continua:
					
					  Los politicos surcoreanos deben sujetar a la gran empresa nacional los intereses y criterios fraccionalistas colocando en la cima a los compatriotas y ponerse al frente de la gran marcha de estos por la reconciliacion, la unidad, la paz y la reunificacion.
					
					  La prioridad actual de los politicos del Norte y el Sur es mantenerse en contacto y conversar.
					
					  Si se toma en cuenta la inminente apertura de las conversaciones militares N-S de alto nivel y el entusiasmo de los habitantes de diferentes sectores por dialogar, resulta ilogico que los politicos se queden con brazos cruzados.
					
					  Los politicos del Norte y el Sur deben impulsar activamente las negociaciones bilaterales y multilaterales para cumplir su mision y deber historicos asumidos ante la epoca y la nacion.
					
					  No hay obstaculos para el contacto y el dialogo. Cada vez que ellos se reunan y conversen, se profundizaran la compresion y la confianza mutuas y contribuiran al mejoramiento de relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					  Si ellos aprecian a la nacion, deberan pensar y actuar siempre para superar las dificultades actuales y realizar la reunificacion de la patria.
					
					  Toda la nacion coreana espera que los politicos de ambas partes coreanas se pongan en la delantera de la lucha patriotica de reunificacion por defender el destino e intereses comunes de todos los compatriotas.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun demanda a Japon devolver bienes culturales saqueados
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun demanda a Japon devolver bienes culturales saqueados
						
  Pyongyang, 7 de febrero (ATCC) -- Durante el coloniaje sobre Corea que duro casi medio siglo, los imperialistas japoneses destruyeron y saquearon de manera sistematica y organizada las preciosas riquezas culturales de Corea.
					 Revela el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual divulgado este lunes y prosigue:
					
					  Japon debe reconocer y pedir disculpas sinceramente por ese crimen y devolver todos los patrimonios culturales saqueados en Corea.
					
					  Hace poco, una fuente extranjera informo de que los patrimonios culturales coreanos trasladados a Japon se totalizan en cientos de miles. 
					
					  Segun confiesan los mismos japoneses, en el Museo Nacional de Tokio estan exhibidas 40 mil piezas incluyendo las porcelanas. 
					
					  Los museos, galerias, universidades, templos, escuelas de bellas artes, organos y hasta los habitantes de distintas localidades de Japon conservan los bienes coreanos de diversos generos como porcelanas, artesanias metalicas, estatuas de Buda, productos artesanales de piedra preciosa, paja y nacar, dibujos, libros, tipos metalicos, etc.
					
					  El numero de las muy famosas porcelanas Coryo llevadas ilegalmente a ese pais isleno llega a decenas de miles. 
					
					  Los muy cinicos imperialistas japoneses registraron esos bienes robados como "tesoro nacional" de su pais y los exhibieron sin escrupulos en los museos.
					
					  Hasta la fecha, a mas de medio siglo desde la derrota de Japon en la Segunda Guerra Mundial, se desconoce el paradero de muchos patrimonios despojados en Corea.
					
					  Al cometer ese crimen intolerable, los imperialistas japoneses pretendieron exterminar a la nacion coreana suprimiendo sus tradiciones culturales y espiritu reflejados en esas herencias materiales transmitidas desde remota antiguedad.

articles.title: Desmentido pretexto usado por Japon para desarrollar misiles
articles.content:
Desmentido pretexto usado por Japon para desarrollar misiles
						
Pyongyang, 7 de febrero (ATCC) -- Recientemente, Japon definio el "desarrollo nuclear y de misiles" de Corea como "amenaza militar" en su nuevo "programa de defensa".
					  Este pretexto rutinario de Japon es para justificar la militarizacion de si mismo.
					
					  Segun un dato que revelo la esencia del programa de misiles de ese pais isleno, la tecnologia japonesa alcanzo practicamente el nivel avanzado en escala mundial.
					
					  Su primer misil "ASM-1", disenado para atacar los buques de guerra de tamanos mediano y grande, entro en el proceso de desarrollo en 1972 y ha sido completado en 1981.
					
					  "ASM-1" con el alcance maximo de 50 kilometros fue emplazado en las "Fuerzas Aereas de Autodefensa" en 1982 y sus variedades tienen alcances mas largos.
					
					  En 1984, la Agencia de Defensa de Japon acelero el programa de misiles de mediano alcance de tipo "XSSM-1".  Estos misiles capaces de navegar a ras de tierra tienen 5 metros de largo, pesan 650kg en el momento de lanzamiento y fueron emplazados en las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" en 1990.
					
					  Ya en 1957, Japon invento los misiles antitanques de primera generacion y 7 anos despues, los de segunda generacion. Ademas, ya fueron desarrollados los misiles de tercera y cuarta generaciones.
					
					  Los misiles antitanques teledirigidos por laser con gran poder fueron desarrollados en 1978 y ubicados en las unidades en 1990 tras pasar las pruebas en 1982 y en 1985.
					
					  En particular, los satelites artificiales "H-2" y "M-5" y el cohete transportador de tipo "N" pueden convertirse de la noche a la manana en los misiles de largo alcance.
					
					  Como muestra la realidad, el escandalo armado por Japon pretextando hacer frente a la "amenaza de misiles" de la RPDC fue una farsa para enganar a la sociedad internacional.

articles.title: Obra clasica china adaptada por artistas coreanos
articles.content:
Obra clasica china adaptada por artistas coreanos
 Pyongyang, 7 de febrero (ATCC) -- "El sueno en la camara roja", novela larga china creada hace ahora cientos de anos, es conocida como "balance de la cultura tradicional de 5 milenios de la nacion china". 
					  Los chinos se mostraron escepticos cuando conocieron que se adaptaba en Corea esa famosa obra dificil de interpretar debido a su contenido muy profundo y amplio. 
					
					  Pero, los artistas coreanos lo hicieron por fin y realizaron una gira por Beijing y otras 6 ciudades chinas a partir de mayo de 2010.
					
					  Los artistas del Conjunto Operistico Mar de Sangre de Corea estrenaron su opera en el Gran Teatro Estatal de Beijing adonde volvieron el 5 de julio del mimo ano a peticion de los pekineses. 
					
					  Los espectadores chinos quedaron maravillados de talentos artisticos y espiritu creativo de los artistas coreanos.
					
					  "El sueno en la camara roja" de version coreana se caracteriza por las canciones y danzas elegantes y la escenografia magnifica.
					
					  La primera version coreana fue creada en la decada de 1960 por la iniciativa del Presidente Kim Il Sung. 
					
					  Con motivo del "Ano de amistad China-Corea" (2010), el Dirigente Kim Jong Il dio la indicacion de recrear esa opera china y guio esta labor viendola en varias ocasiones. 
					
					  Los chinos califican de milagroso el hecho de que los artistas coreanos interpretaron esa opera entendiendo perfectamente el contenido y las relaciones entre las figuras que aparecen en su obra original.

articles.title: Se alza en escala mundial el precio de alimentos
articles.content:
Se alza en escala mundial el precio de alimentos
Pyongyang, 7 de febrero (ATCC) -- Causa grandes preocupaciones la subida brusca de los precios de alimentos en escala mundial.
					Citando los reportes de investigacion, la FAO informo el dia 3 que desde diciembre del ano pasado hasta enero del ano en curso, el indice mensual mundial de esos precios volvio a subir 3.4 %.
					
					Segun estimaciones, ese porcentaje es el record desde 1990 cuando comenzo la medicion de precios de alimentos y el alza proseguira por varios meses.
